00032 distribute copies of the software, or if you modify it.
00033

00035 gratis or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that
00036 you have.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the
00037 source code.  And you must show them these terms so they know their
00038 rights.
00039 
00040   We protect your rights with two steps: (1) copyright the software, and
00041 (2) offer you this license which gives you legal permission to copy,
00042 distribute and/or modify the software.
00043 
00044   Also, for each author's protection and ours, we want to make certain
00045 that everyone understands that there is no warranty for this free
00046 software.  If the software is modified by someone else and passed on, we
00047 want its recipients to know that what they have is not the original, so
00048 that any problems introduced by others will not reflect on the original

00052 patents.  We wish to avoid the danger that redistributors of a free
00053 program will individually obtain patent licenses, in effect making the
00054 program proprietary.  To prevent this, we have made it clear that any
00055 patent must be licensed for everyone's free use or not licensed at all.

00289 #include <CServerInstance.h>
00290 #include <CTCPConnectionLost.h>

00292 // Constructors.
00293 
00300 CServerInstance::CServerInstance(CSocket* pSocket, bool fDeleteSocket) :
00301   CFileEvent(pSocket->getSocketFd()),
00302   m_pPeer(pSocket),
00303   m_fDeleteSocket(fDeleteSocket)
00304 {}
00305 
00314 CServerInstance::CServerInstance(const char* pName, CSocket* pSocket,
00315                                  bool fDeleteSocket) : 
00316   CFileEvent(pName, pSocket->getSocketFd()),
00317   m_pPeer(pSocket),
00318   m_fDeleteSocket(fDeleteSocket)
00319 {}
00328 CServerInstance::CServerInstance(const string& rName, CSocket* pSocket,
00329                                  bool fDeleteSocket) :
00330   CFileEvent(rName, pSocket->getSocketFd()),
00331   m_pPeer(pSocket),
00332   m_fDeleteSocket(fDeleteSocket)
00333 {}
00334 
00338 CServerInstance::~CServerInstance()
00339 {
00340   if(m_pPeer->getState() == CSocket::Connected) {       // Shutdown connection if
00341     m_pPeer->Shutdown();                        // necessary.
00342   }
00343   if(m_fDeleteSocket) delete m_pPeer;
00344 }

00347 
00348 
00360 string
00361 CServerInstance::getPeername() const
00362 {
00363   string peername;
00364   unsigned short  port;
00365   
00366   m_pPeer->getPeer(port, peername);
00367 
00368   return peername;
00369 }
00370 
00371 
00379 unsigned short
00380 CServerInstance::getPeerPort() const
00381 {
00382   string peername;
00383   unsigned short port;
00384 
00385   m_pPeer->getPeer(port, peername);
00386 
00387   return port;
00388 }

00390 // Class functions.
00391 
00401 void
00402 CServerInstance::OnReadable(istream& rInput)
00403 {
00404   try {
00405     OnRequest(m_pPeer);
00406   }
00407   catch (CTCPConnectionLost& rLost) {
00408     Shutdown();
00409   }
00410 }
00417 void
00418 CServerInstance::OnRequest(CSocket* pConnection)
00419 {
00420 }
00421 
00422 
00433 void 
00434 CServerInstance::Shutdown()
00435 {
00436   if(m_pPeer->getState() == CSocket::Connected) {       // If needed shut down
00437     m_pPeer->Shutdown();                        // Connection
00438   }
00439   MonitorReadable(false);       // Stop monitoring request arrival.
00440   setEnable(false);             // Disable thread on next pass through loop.
00441   
00442 }
00446 string
00447 CServerInstance::DescribeSelf()
00448 {
00449   string result("Server instance: \n");
00450   char val[10];
00451 
00452   result += CEvent::DescribeSelf();
00453   result += "Socket State: ";
00454   result += CSocket::StateName(m_pPeer->getState());
00455   result += " Fd= ";
00456   sprintf(val, "%d", m_pPeer->getSocketFd());
00457   result += val;
00458   result += (m_fDeleteSocket ? string(" Delete socket on destruct\n") : 
00459                               string(" Keep socket on destruct\n"));
00460   return result;
00461 }
